title: Contributing to finsyncR
text: try follow GitHub flow development. Fork repo clone computer. learn process, see guide. forked cloned project since worked , pull changes original repo clone using git pull upstream main. Open RStudio project file (.Rproj). Write code. Test code (bonus points adding unit tests). Document code (see function documentation ). Check code devtools::check() aim 0 errors warnings. Commit push changes. Submit pull request.

title: Getting Started
text: Currently, two groups functions finsyncR R package. first group Biotic Datasets group functions: getInvertData() getFishData(). functions similar parameters, unique aspects users aware . Starting getInvertData() function. function retrieves, cleans, compiles stream macro-invertebrate datasets collected USGS USEPA. function corrects differences sample splitting varied sampling identification methods, well changes taxonomy time. parameters getInvertData() function dataType, taxonLevel, taxonFix, agency, lifestage, rarefy, sharedTaxa, seed boatableStreams. dataType refers whether site taxa matrix contain abundance (dataType = "abun") presence/absence (coded 1/0; dataType = "occur") values. taxonLevel refers taxonomic resolution (Class, Family, etc.) site taxa matrix generated. values must start capital letter. ensure compatibility among USGS EPA datasets, well minimize variation among taxonomists, "Genus" finest taxonomic resolution available. taxonFix provides ways handle changes taxonomy across time, especially instances species reorganized new genera. Across time span datasets, taxonomy many species changed. cases specimen identified species, able update genus designation bench identification now used genus names. cases, given specimen identified genus bench, species within given genus moved new genus. scenario prevented us confident identity current genus given specimen. cases, specimen identified bench multiple species genera names (e.g., species1/species2 genus1/genus2). instances combined genera names consistent EPA USGS. Therefore, USGS contain specimen identified genus1/genus2, EPA included instances separate identifications genus1 genus2. ensure consistency programs, renamed single instances genus1 genus2 genus1/genus2 throughout combined EPA USGS dataset. , provide three options addressing taxonomic issues present USGS EPA invertebrate datasets. taxonFix operates genera level, set taxonFix = "none" taxonLevel set "Subfamily" higher taxonomic resolution. taxonFix = "none" makes adjustment. taxonFix = "none", still generate ‚Äúslash‚Äù genera, , link genera larger linked genera (see ). recommend using approach taxonLevel "Genus". taxonFix = "lump" prioritizes retaining observations specimens giving unified name (e.g., genus1/genus2/genus3) complex genera linked changes taxonomy time. approach, inflation number genera given individual genera (e.g., genus1) never appeared outside unified genera name (e.g., genus1/genus2/genus3). Within combined EPA USGS datasets, 98 genera exist linked changes taxonomy time. ‚Äúnon-problematic‚Äù genera retained. taxonFix = "lump" results 13 ‚Äúlumped‚Äù genera (see Figure 1 ). new ‚Äúlumped‚Äù genera 2 ‚Äúold‚Äù genera joined. One complex genera (within Ephemeroptera) includes 70 ‚Äúold‚Äù genera, second complex Ephemeroptera genera included six individual genera. taxonFix = "lump" used analyses Rumschlag et al.¬†(2023)). taxonFix = "remove" prioritizes accurate identification dropping observations problematic genera species identification. taxonFix = "remove" still prioritizes accurate identifications dropping obscure identifications, slash genera genera complexes dropped; result many fewer genera included final dataset, conservative approach accuracy identifications high priority. Figure 1. Visualization relationship among linked genera (number represents individual genera original datasets). Linkages indicate taxonomic designation least one species one genera pairs updated genera pair. Clusters (genera complexes) formed sets linkages. largest genera complex represented 70 Ephemeroptera genera. See Table 1 table linking numbers cluster genera names. agency refers agency collected datasets, recommend keeping set default c("USGS", "EPA"), result largest dataset, users aware sampling design (site selection, sample methology) agency quite different. Specifically, sampling locations USGS dataset constrained region /surrounding landuse, USGS dataset provides sampling locations longest duration collection. Conversely, sampling locations EPA datasets chosen randomly, collected two-year phases 4 years phases.Users familiarize sampling manuals agencies: USGS NAWQA EPA NRSA. Finally, USGS sampling locations considered wadeable streams, EPA samples wadeable streams boatable rivers. , boatableStreams TRUE agency set "EPA" , ensure highest level comparability/compatibility two agency datasets. rarefy refers whether samples rarefied 300 individuals obtain species richness values biased based number individuals identified within sample (See Figure 2 , taken Rumschlag et al.¬†(2023)). rarefy = TRUE, samples 300+ individuals identified retained. Thus, ~17% samples removed, <300 individuals sampled. set rarefaction threshold 300, 1) every 50 individuals identified, ~1 genera added sample 2) 82.8% samples least 300 individuals identified. Thus, lowering threshold 200 individuals removed ~2 genera per sample, added additional 7.3% samples included (90.1% 82.8%). Similarly, increasing threshold 400 individuals added ~2 genera per sample, reduced samples 30.3% samples. Figure 2. Visualization relationship mean number genera gains, proportion samples least n number organisms identified, number organisms identified er sample, justifying use 300 rarefication threshold. target specimen (.e., number specimen identified bench) varies across programs, agencies, time, space, necessary use rarefy = TRUE calculating diversity metrics datasets, order better account differences among samples driven differences raw number individuals identified within sample. Use seed = provide integer get consistent output community data (passed set.seed() internally). rarefy = TRUE can used wanting occurrence data (presence/absence) proportional data (taxon represents certain percent sample). generate density values, use dataType = "abun" rarefy = FALSE. lifestage refers whether generated site taxa matrix include lifestage information taxa/individuals collected. lifestage = TRUE, generated matrix separate columns various lifestages collected taxa. Lifestage noted within USGS samples, within EPA datasets; , lifestage = TRUE provide lifestage information USGS samples. sharedTaxa refers whether resulting dataset contain taxa found agency datasets. Set sharedTaxa = FALSE using data one agency. recommend using sharedTaxa = TRUE comparing across agencies, species pools consistent.
code: ##This code will generate density estimates at the family level for all samples ##in the NAWQA database. Lifestage information will be ignored.  Inverts <- getInvertData(dataType = "abun",                          taxonLevel = "Genus",                          agency = "USGS",                          lifestage = FALSE,                          rarefy = FALSE,                          seed = 1,                          boatableStreams = FALSE) #>  Gathering and cleaning USGS raw data #> Warning in open.connection(file, "rt"): cannot open zip file '' #> Error in open.connection(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection  head(Inverts)[,1:35] #>           SIDNO ReleaseCategory ProvisionalData ProjectLabel      SiteNumber CollectionDate StartTime SampleTypeCode #> 1 BDB-000025076          Public                  WHMI BioTDB 393259085101200           <NA>     08:00           IRTH #> 2 BDB-000025076          Public                  WHMI BioTDB 393259085101200           <NA>     08:00           IRTH #> 3 BDB-000025076          Public                  WHMI BioTDB 393259085101200           <NA>     08:00           IRTH #> 4 BDB-000025076          Public                  WHMI BioTDB 393259085101200           <NA>     08:00           IRTH #> 5 BDB-000025076          Public                  WHMI BioTDB 393259085101200           <NA>     08:00           IRTH #> 6 BDB-000025076          Public                  WHMI BioTDB 393259085101200           <NA>     08:00           IRTH #>   SiteVisitSampleNumber ProjectAssignedSampleLabel                          SiteName                 StudyReachName #> 1                 25076                            Whitewater River nr. Nulltown, IN 393259085101200-A-NAWQA-BioTDB #> 2                 25076                            Whitewater River nr. Nulltown, IN 393259085101200-A-NAWQA-BioTDB #> 3                 25076                            Whitewater River nr. Nulltown, IN 393259085101200-A-NAWQA-BioTDB #> 4                 25076                            Whitewater River nr. Nulltown, IN 393259085101200-A-NAWQA-BioTDB #> 6                 25076                            Whitewater River nr. Nulltown, IN 393259085101200-A-NAWQA-BioTDB #>   TimeDatum CollectionYear CollectionMonth CollectionDayOfYear      NAWQA.SMCOD NAWQAStudyUnitCode LabOrderID #> 1                     1999               7                 194 MIAM0799IRM0004*               WHMI         NA #> 2                     1999               7                 194 MIAM0799IRM0004*               WHMI         NA #> 3                     1999               7                 194 MIAM0799IRM0004*               WHMI         NA #> 4                     1999               7                 194 MIAM0799IRM0004*               WHMI         NA #> 5                     1999               7                 194 MIAM0799IRM0004*               WHMI         NA #> 6                     1999               7                 194 MIAM0799IRM0004*               WHMI         NA #>   LabRecordID FieldComponent LabComponent LabProcName TaxonomicResultReviewStatus PublishedSortOrder #> 1        6927              M                            S - Presumed Satisfactory            2001017 #> 2        6945              M                            S - Presumed Satisfactory            2001660 #> 3        6929              M                            S - Presumed Satisfactory            2002245 #> 4        6928              M                            S - Presumed Satisfactory            2002283 #> 5        6932              M                            S - Presumed Satisfactory            2002577 #> 6        6931              M                            S - Presumed Satisfactory            2002684 #>      BioDataTaxonName BioDataShortName      BenchTaxonName BenchTaxonNameReferenceCode Density_m2 Abundance AdjRawCount #> 1               Acari         Acari_74               Acari                                 188.16       235         235 #> 2       Ephoron album       Ep_albu476       Ephoron album                                   4.00         5           5 #> 3              Baetis        Baeti_612              Baetis                                1364.16      1705        1705 #> 4 Baetis intercalaris       Ba_inte617 Baetis intercalaris                                1505.28      1882        1882 #> 5       Heptageniidae        Hepta_672       Heptageniidae                                 141.12       176         176 #> 6          Leucrocuta        Leucr_694          Leucrocuta                                  47.04        59          59 #>   RawCount TotAreaSampled_m2 FieldSplitRatio #> 1        4              1.25               1 #> 2        5              1.25               1 #> 3       29              1.25               1 #> 4       32              1.25               1 #> 5        3              1.25               1 #> 6        1              1.25               1

title: Getting Started
text: second function Biotic Datasets group functions getFishData(). function retrieves, cleans, compiles stream fish datasets USGS USEPA. differences fish sampled (e.g., netting, electroshocking, snorkeling), sampling methodologies retained, difficult combine samples disparate methods. However, provide standardization abundances within sample methods (individuals per unit effort per meter stream sampled), well option multigear mean standardization (see ). Fish species names updated, species current synonymous names datasets combined current scientific name. parameters getFishData() function dataType, taxonLevel, agency, standardize, hybrids, boatableStreams. dataType refers whether site taxa matrix contain abundance (dataType = "abun") presence/absence (coded 1/0; dataType = "occur") values. taxonLevel refers taxonomic resolution (Family, Genus, Species) site taxa matrix generated. values must start capital letter. function can generate taxa sample matrices Family, Genus, Species resolution. agencyrefers agency collected datasets, recommend keeping set default c("USGS", "EPA"), result largest dataset. Users aware sampling schemes different agencies. Specifically, sampling locations USGS dataset constrained region /surrounding landuse, USGS dataset provides sampling locations longest duration collection. Conversely, sampling locations EPA datasets chosen randomly, collected two-year phases 4 years phases. standardize refers whether abundance values site taxa matrix standardized unit effort (individuals per unit effort per meter sampled). Specifically, standardize = "CPUE" results abundances divided seconds shocked, number seine hauls, etc. values divided stream length sampled. standardize = "MGMS", abundances standardized CPUE, mean total CPUE (summation CPUEs taxa site collection date) calculated sampling method. CPUE value divided mean total CPUE mean total CPUE respective sampling methods. MGMS one row time-location function standardizes sampling method addition area sampled, meaning resulting abundance values summed sampling methods time-location sampling event. See supplement Gibson-Reinemer et al.¬†(2017) example MGMS computation. highly recommended users set standardize either ‚ÄúCPUE" "MGMS" interested comparing abundance values across sites. Note: ~35 samples lacked required standardization information. Therefore, interested occurrence (presence/absence) data , set standardize = "none" dataType = "occur". Users aware setting standardize = "none" result larger dataset additional samples/sites standardize = "CPUE" standardize = "MGMS". hybrid refers whether output dataset include fish identified hybrids two species. conversations fish experts, recommend keeping set default hybrid = FALSE, hybrids notoriously difficult identify may equate unique species. Finally, boatableStreams refers whether boatable streams included EPA dataset. Since USGS sites coded ‚Äúwadeable‚Äù, boatableStreams TRUE agency set "EPA" ensure highest level comparability/compatibility two agency datasets.
code: ##This code will generate density estimates at the Family level for all samples ##in the NAWQA database.  Fish <- getFishData(dataType = "occur",                     taxonLevel = "Family",                     agency = c("USGS", "EPA"),                     standardize = "none",                     hybrids = FALSE,                     boatableStreams = FALSE) #>  Gathering and cleaning USGS raw data #> Warning in open.connection(file, "rt"): cannot open zip file '' #> Error in open.connection(file, "rt"): cannot open the connection  head(Fish)[,1:35] #> Error in head(Fish): object 'Fish' not found

title: Getting Started
text: several instances within fish data field biologists collect fish. samples indicated ‚Äú.Fish‚Äù column. Users avoid column calculating diversity metrics conducting multivariate analyses. resulting fish data include information reach length fished (ReachLengthFished_m), sampling method employed (e.g., electrochocking, seining, snorkelling; MethodBasic), standardizeand effort values (e.g., minutes shocking, number seine hauls, minutes snorkeling; StandardMethod), specific protocol employed (e.g., NRSA small stream, NRSA large stream, etc.; FISH_PROTOCOL). Users note conductivity can influence efficiency electroshocking (e.g., Lyon et al.¬†2014), , conductivity may important covariate account using electroshocking data, conductivity likely large ranges among sites within datasets.

title: Getting Started
text: Another function finsyncR package getNLCDData(), provides access catchment-watershed-level NLCD land use/land cover datasets. Land-use/land-cover data extracted USGS National Land Cover Database (NLCD) generated StreamCat (Hill et al.¬†2015). function pulls internally stored data, rather pinging StreamCat database, effort speed data access. LULC data available following years: 2001, 2004, 2006, 2008, 2011, 2013, 2016, 2019. instances years input data exact year matches list, years temporally matched closest year LULC data (e.g.¬†site sampled 1995 LULC data 2001). Note samples fall midpoint two NLCD years (e.g.¬†2005), function defaults earlier year (e.g.¬†site sampled 2005 LULC data 2004). Data can extracted catchment Cat watershed Ws scales. Watershed larger catchment, includes land drains downstream sampling location. Catchment includes land upstream sampling location. See StreamCat documentation information. LULC data can grouped group = TRUE five broad categories. categories include ‚Äúwater‚Äù (grouping wetland open water land covers), ‚Äúurban‚Äù (grouping urban land use), ‚Äúforest‚Äù (grouping deciduous, coniferous, mixed forests land covers), ‚Äúopen‚Äù (grouping shrub, barren land, grassland, hay/pasture land covers), ‚Äúcrop‚Äù (grouping, just crop land use).
code: dat = data.frame(SiteNumber = "USGS-05276005",                  CollectionYear = c(2005, 2007, 2009))  getNLCDData(data = dat,             scale = "Cat",             group = FALSE) #>      SiteNumber CollectionYear PCTURBMD_Cat PCTMXFST_Cat PCTHAY_Cat PCTURBLO_Cat PCTSHRB_Cat PCTURBHI_Cat PCTHBWET_Cat #> 1 USGS-05276005           2005         0.25         1.02      41.31         3.84           0         0.11         2.81 #> 2 USGS-05276005           2007         0.35         1.02      41.48         3.84           0         0.11         2.64 #> 3 USGS-05276005           2009         0.46         1.02      41.48         3.91           0         0.11         2.50 #>   PCTCROP_Cat PCTGRS_Cat PCTOW_Cat PCTBL_Cat PCTCONIF_Cat PCTDECID_Cat PCTURBOP_Cat PCTWDWET_Cat #> 1       38.56          0         0         0            0         0.46         3.20         8.44 #> 2       38.56          0         0         0            0         0.46         3.10         8.44 #> 3       38.56          0         0         0            0         0.46         2.92         8.59

title: Metadata
text: Description: Agency oversaw collection sample. Categorical. Levels: ‚ÄúEPA‚Äù - United States Environmental Protection Agency ‚ÄúUSGS‚Äù - United States Geological Survey

title: Metadata
text: Description: Project short name assigned project owner. USGS data, ProjectLabel explicitly provided USGS. EPA, ProjectLabelis sampling round/type (e.g., NRSA0809). Categorical.

title: Metadata
text: Description: Unique site identifiers. USGS data, SiteNumber USGS National Water Information System (NWIS) 8 15-digit identifier place sample collected (preceeded ‚ÄúUSGS-‚Äù). EPA data, SiteNumber NARS ‚ÄúSITE_ID‚Äù variable, preferred form NRS_MM-xxxxx, MM two letter state code, xxxxx 10001 99999. EPA unique site ID (UNIQUE_ID) used place SITE_ID , link sites temporally. SITE_IDs individual rounds NRSA sampling (WSA/EMAP included) linked site-level UNIQUE_ID, sites resampled time linked. sites linked UNIQUE_ID, survey-specific SITE_ID used instead. Categorical. EPA preferred form NRS_MM-xxxxx, MM two letter state code, xxxxx 10001 99999. USGS form USGS-xxxxxxxx, xxxxxxxx 8 15-digit USGS NWIS identifier. Note: link EPA unique site IDs survey-specific site IDs (e.g., used link NARS collected data), users can link unified site IDs survey-specific ID using following code:
code: dataset$SurveySpecificSiteID <-   ifelse(dataset$SiteNumber %in% finsyncR:::.NRSA_siteIDs$UNIQUE_ID,          finsyncR:::.NRSA_siteIDs$SITE_ID[            match(dataset$SiteNumber,                  finsyncR:::.NRSA_siteIDs$UNIQUE_ID)],          ifelse(dataset$SiteNumber %in% finsyncR:::.NRSA_siteIDs$MASTER_SITEID,                 finsyncR:::.NRSA_siteIDs$SITE_ID[                   match(dataset$SiteNumber,                         finsyncR:::.NRSA_siteIDs$MASTER_SITEID)],                 dataset$SiteNumber))

title: Metadata
text: Description: Strahler stream order. Moving waters first order outermost tributaries. two streams order merge, resulting stream given number one higher. two rivers different stream orders merge, resulting stream given higher two numbers. Integer.

title: Metadata
text: Description: Provided EPA samples . Measured distance left right bank stream channel filled water. Meters. Numeric.

title: Metadata
text: Description: Predicted distance left right bank stream channel filled water. Gathered StreamCat Doyle, Jessie M., Hill, Ryan ., Leibowitz, Scott G. Ebersole, Joseph L.. 2023. "Random forest models estimate bankfull low flow channel widths depths across conterminous United States." JAWRA Journal American Water Resources Association 59(5): 1099‚Äì1114. https://doi.org/10.1111/1752-1688.13116. Provided sites. Meters. Numeric.

title: Metadata
text: Description: Code indicating method sample collected Categorical. Levels: Inverts: ‚ÄúIRTH‚Äù - USGS NAWQA Invertebrate Targeted Habitat; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12232/ ‚ÄúBERW‚Äù - NRSA Invertebrate, wadable, reach-wide benthos; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12564/ ‚ÄúSWAMP‚Äù - SWAMP Reachwide Benthos (Multihabitat) Procedure; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12835/ ‚ÄúEMAP‚Äù - Macroinvertebrate Field Laboratory Methods Evaluating Biological Integrity Surface Waters; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12955/ ‚ÄúCDPHE RR‚Äù - Benthic Macroinvertebrate,Riffle Run Habitat Method; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12896/ ‚ÄúPNAMP‚Äù - Pacific Northwest, wadeable streams; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12579/ ‚ÄúBERWW‚Äù - NRSA Invertebrate, wadable, reach-wide benthos; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12564/ ‚ÄúREACHWIDE‚Äù - NRSA Invertebrate, wadable, reach-wide benthos; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12564/ ‚ÄúBELGB‚Äù - NRSA Invertebrate, non-wadeable, reach-wide benthos; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12563/ ‚ÄúBETB‚Äù - NRSA Invertebrate, non-wadeable, reach-wide benthos; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12563/ ‚ÄúBOATABLE‚Äù - NRSA Invertebrate, non-wadeable, reach-wide benthos; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12563/ Fish: ‚ÄúBOATABLE‚Äù - Sample protocol non-wadable rivers; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12492/ ‚ÄúSM_WADEABLE‚Äù - Sample protocol small wadeable streams; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12237/, https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12493/ ‚ÄúLG_WADEABLE‚Äù - Sample protocol large wadeable streams; https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12237/, https://www.nemi.gov/methods/method_summary/12493/

what: An R Package to synchronize fish and invertebrate datasets from federal sources in the United States
title: An R Package to synchronize fish and invertebrate datasets from federal sources in the United States
text: finsyncR (fish invertebrate synchronizer R) data management package integrates processes national-level aquatic biomonitoring datasets U.S., focus fish macroinvertebrates sampled rivers streams. package streamlines process retrieving harmonizing data, improving access cleaned data making application data straightforward researchers. sources data package United States Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs (USEPA) National Aquatic Resource Surveys (NARS), namely National River Streams Assessment (NRSA), United States Geological Survey‚Äôs (USGS) BioData.

title: An R Package to synchronize fish and invertebrate datasets from federal sources in the United States
text: can install released version finsyncR GitHub :

title: An R Package to synchronize fish and invertebrate datasets from federal sources in the United States
text: basic example shows use getFishData() function generate fish dataset USGS USEPA datasets.
code: library(finsyncR)  Fish <- getFishData(taxonLevel = "Species",                     agency = c("USGS","EPA")) #>  Gathering and cleaning USGS raw data                     Applying taxonomic fixes to USGS data                     Applying count standardization to USGS data                     Gathering, joining, and cleaning EPA raw data                     Applying taxonomic fixes to EPA data                     Applying count standardization to EPA data                     Harmonizing USGS and EPA data                                      Finalizing data for output                           finsyncR data synchronization complete  head(Fish)[,c(1:5,36,90,400)] #>   Agency ProjectLabel    SiteNumber      StudyReachName CollectionDate #> 1   USGS     MMSD Eco USGS-04086600 04086600-A-MMSD Eco     2007-09-10 #> 2   USGS     MMSD Eco USGS-04087030 04087030-A-MMSD Eco     2007-09-05 #> 3   USGS     MMSD Eco USGS-04087070 04087070-A-MMSD Eco     2007-09-05 #> 4   USGS     MMSD Eco USGS-04087088 04087088-A-MMSD Eco     2007-09-04 #> 5   USGS     MMSD Eco USGS-04087119 04087119-A-MMSD Eco     2007-09-12 #> 6   USGS     MMSD Eco USGS-04087204 04087204-A-MMSD Eco     2007-09-07 #>   Ameiurus.melas Clinostomus.funduloides Strongylura.marina #> 1              0                       0                  0 #> 2              0                       0                  0 #> 3              0                       0                  0 #> 4              0                       0                  0 #> 5              0                       0                  0 #> 6              0                       0                  0

title: finsyncR: An R Package to synchronize fish and invertebrate datasets from federal sources in the United States ‚Äî finsyncR-package
text: finsyncR (fish invertebrate synchronizer R) provides access , manipulates, harmonizes national-level aquatic biomonitoring datasets United States, focus fish macroinvertebrates sampled rivers streams. package streamlines process retrieving working data, making process utilizing data  easier researchers. data resources used package United States Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs National Aquatic Resources Surveys, namely National River Streams Assessment, United States Geological Survey‚Äôs BioData. package provides abundance (density) occurrence data fish macroinvertebrates variety levels taxonomic resolution. Alongside community matrices, important data describing sampling methods provided, intended used covariates analyses. package provides flexibility common data management issues temporal biologic datasets. Data management options include harmonization macroinvertebrate taxonomy across two federal datasets time ability drop hybrid organisms altogether fish. Samples, often vary number individuals within sample, can rarefied specific count. Additionally, fish samples can standardized catch per-unit effort account catchability differences fish sampling methods. package can also match  sampling sites fish macroinvertebrates data National Land Cover Database. Data USGS BioData obtained Pete Ruhl (pmruhl@usgs.gov), data National Aquatic Resource Surveys directly downloaded package NARS website. Users cite aforementioned datasets follows: U.S. Geological Survey, 2020. BioData - Aquatic bioassessment data Nation: U.S. Geological Survey database, accessed 17 December 2020, https://doi.org/10.5066/F77W698B U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. 2006. National Aquatic Resource Surveys. Wadeable Streams Assessment 2004 (data metadata files). Available U.S. EPA web page: https://www.epa.gov/national-aquatic-resource-surveys/data-national-aquatic-resource-surveys. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. 2016. National Aquatic Resource Surveys. National Rivers Streams Assessment 2013-2014 (data metadata files). Available U.S. EPA web page: https://www.epa.gov/national-aquatic-resource-surveys/data-national-aquatic-resource-surveys. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. 2022. National Aquatic Resource Surveys. National Rivers Streams Assessment 2018-2019 (data metadata files). Available U.S. EPA web page: https://www.epa.gov/national-aquatic-resource-surveys/data-national-aquatic-resource-surveys. what: Access and harmonize fish data ‚Äî getFishData

title: Access and harmonize fish data ‚Äî getFishData
code: getFishData(   dataType = "occur",   taxonLevel = "Species",   agency = c("USGS", "EPA"),   standardize = "none",   hybrids = FALSE,   sharedTaxa = FALSE,   boatableStreams = FALSE )

title: Access and harmonize fish data ‚Äî getFishData
text: dataType Output data type community matrix, either "abun" (abundance) "occur" (occurrence). taxonLevel Level taxonomic resolution community matrix. Input must one : "Family", "Genus", "Species". agency agency name names (e.g., "USGS" "EPA") source data output community matrix. See Details information. standardize Standardization method used calculating fish abundance matrices. Default standardize = "none", returns raw fish count values. options include standardize = "CPUE", returns standardized abundances Catch per Unit Effort. alternative standardization method standardize = "MGMS", uses Multigear Mean Standardization (MGMS) values account catchability differences fish sampling methods. See 'Details' information standardizations. hybrids logical. hybrid individuals included output dataset? TRUE FALSE. sharedTaxa logical. taxa limited organisms appear EPA USGS datasets? TRUE FALSE. Must set FALSE one agency specified. boatableStreams logical. EPA boatable streams included output dataset? TRUE FALSE. Note: USGS streams wadable. advisable include boatable streams building dataset including EPA USGS data. Boatable EPA data wadeable USGS data considered comparable.

title: Access and harmonize fish data ‚Äî getFishData
text: taxa sample data frame site, stream reach, sample information.

title: Access and harmonize fish data ‚Äî getFishData
text: standardize fish abundance data, abundances divided product sampling effort (minutes shocked, number seine hauls, number snorkeling transects) stream length sampled. $$CPUE = \frac{taxa~abundance}{(sampling~effort~*~stream~length~fished~(m))}$$ samples lacked information either stream length sampled sampling effort. Therefore, user interested occurrence (pres/abs) data , set dataType = "occur" standardize = "none", provide occurrence dataset samples otherwise dropped standardization. aware setting dataType = "occur" result larger dataset additional samples/sites dataType = "abun". account differences efficacy shocking, seine netting, snorkeling, multigear mean standardization (standardize = "MGMS") another standardization method provided alternative catch per unit effort (standardize = "CPUE"). (standardize = "MGMS"), individual taxa abundances standardized CPUE. , total catch (TC) taxa sample j standardized product sampling effort (minutes shocked, number seine hauls, number snorkeling transects) stream length sampled: \(TCPUE = \frac{TC_j}{(sampling~effort~*~stream~length~fished~(m))}\). gear type (e.g., electroshock, seine net, snorkel), mean TCPUE calculated, \(\overline{TCPUE}\). Next, standardize gear, CPUE taxa divided \(\overline{TCPUE}\). $$MSC_{ij} = \frac{CPUE_{ij}}{\overline{TCPUE}}$$ \(MSC_{ij}\) mean standardized catch species observation j. units sampling effort cancelled calculation \(MSC_{ij}\), patterns relative abundance species within across observations preserved. function sums \(MSC_{ij}\) among gear types, resulting single row data sampling event, regardless number gear types used, setting standardize = "CPUE" result rows within output dataset standardize = "MGMS". See Gibson-Reinemer et al. (2017) information regarding computation MGMS. agency refers federal agency collected fish samples. want use data agencies, set agency = c("USGS", "EPA"), default. Note default, moving waters classified "wadeable" included, setting boatableStreams = TRUE include non-wadeable streams. information included EPA dataset included USGS datasets, specifically observed wetted width stream river.

code: getInvertData(   dataType = "occur",   taxonLevel = "Genus",   taxonFix = "lump",   agency = c("USGS", "EPA"),   lifestage = FALSE,   rarefy = TRUE,   rarefyCount = 300,   sharedTaxa = FALSE,   seed = 0,   boatableStreams = FALSE )

title: Access and harmonize macroinvertebrate data ‚Äî getInvertData
text: dataType Output data type community matrix, either "abun" (abundance) "occur" (occurrence). taxonLevel Level taxonomic resolution community matrix. Input must one : "Phylum", "Class", "Order", "Family", "Genus", "Species". taxonFix Option account changes taxonomy across time, must one : "none", "lump", "remove". See Details information. agency agency name names (e.g., "USGS" "EPA") source data output community matrix. See Details information. lifestage logical. USGS data , output dataset include lifestage information individual?  TRUE FALSE. rarefy logical. samples standardized number individuals identified within sample? TRUE FALSE. See Details information. rarefyCount integer. rarefy = TRUE, individual count used cutoff rarefaction (standardizing samples number individuals identified). Default 300. sharedTaxa logical. Genera limited appear EPA USGS datasets? TRUE FALSE. Must set FALSE one agency specified. seed numeric. Set seed rarefy get consistent results new iteration function. Value gets passed set.seed internally. boatableStreams logical. EPA boatable streams included output dataset?  TRUE FALSE. Note: USGS streams wadable. advisable include boatable streams building dataset including EPA USGS data. Boatable EPA data wadeable USGS data considered comparable.

title: Access and harmonize macroinvertebrate data ‚Äî getInvertData
text: taxa sample data frame site, stream reach, sample information.

title: Access and harmonize macroinvertebrate data ‚Äî getInvertData
text: taxonFix provides options account changes taxonomy across time, especially instances species reorganized new genera. taxonFix operates genera level. taxonFix = "none" makes adjustment. taxonFix = "lump" prioritizes retaining observations giving unified genera name species genera linked changes taxonomy time (e.g. genera1/genera2/genera3). Note: 98 problematic genera exist throughout datasets, taxonFix = "lump" results 13 "lumped" genera. new "lumped" genera fewer five "old" genera joined. One "lumped" genera (within Ephemeroptera) includes 70 unique genera names. , advisable examine changes Ephemeroptera genera. taxonFix = "remove" prioritizes accurate identifications organisms dropping observations problematic genera species-level identification. Without species-level identification, way assure correct membership updated genus. Organisms species-level identification cross-walked updated genus. NOTE ‚Äúslash‚Äù genera: taxonFix = "lump", "slash" genera rolled larger linked genera, . taxonFix = "remove" prioritizes accurate identifications dropping slash genera , including organisms identified ‚Äúslash‚Äù genus bend; option result many fewer genera final dataset. Finally, taxonFix = "none", includes "slash" genera, connect genera larger linked genera. See vignette("GettingStarted") information. agency refers agency collected invertebrate samples. want use data agencies, set agency = c("USGS", "EPA"), default. USGS data, sampling data include USGS BioData SampleMethodCode "BERW", "IRTH", "SWAMP", "EMAP", "CDPHE", "PNAMP". Note default, moving waters classified "wadeable" included setting boatableStreams = TRUE include observations non-wadeable streams. information included EPA dataset included USGS datasets, specifically observed wetted width stream/river. rarefy = TRUE,  samples rarefyCount+ individuals identified (raw count) retained. Thus, percentage samples removed, <rarefyCount individuals sampled. rarefaction threshold default 300 organisms, 1) every 50 individuals identified, ~1 genera added sample 2) 91.3 \ least 300 individuals identified. Thus, lowering threshold 200 individuals removed ~2 genera per sample, additional 3.2 \ samples included (94.5 \ 400 individuals added ~2 genera per sample, reduced samples 40.6 \ samples. Use seed = ...  get consistent output community data. See vignette("GettingStarted") information regarding rarefaction. NOTE: rarefy = TRUE can used user wants occurrence data (presence/absence) proportional data (taxon represents certain proportion sample). Use rarefy = FALSE densities measure interest. dataType = ‚Äúabun‚Äù, function calculates taxa densities samples using lab subsampling ratios area sampled $$Taxa~abundance = n*\frqc{1}{Subsampling~Ratio}$$ n number specimens identified Subsampling Ratio proportion sample identified lab bench. USGS dataset, incorporates "field split ratio" (proportion sample brought lab specimen identification) "lab subsampling ratio" (proportion grids used identify invertebrates lab bench). EPA datasets, just "lab subsampling ratio", proportion grids used identify invertebrates lab bench. , $$Taxa~density = frac{Taxa~abundance}{Area~sampled~(m^2)}$$ taxa abundance simply divided area sampled estimate density. See vignette("GettingStarted") details calculation taxa densities. Note: 81 sampling events (sampling location - collection date) replicate samples (duplicates). left replicate samples dataset, replicates different stream habitat sampled, may interest certain ecological questions. users like remove data reduce potential effects replicate samples analyses, use data %>% group_by(Site_Number, CollectionDayOfYear) %>% slice(1) retain one replicate sampling event dataset.

what: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: function match National Land Cover Database (NLCD) data fish macroinvertebrate sampling site space time calling StreamCat.

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: data Input dataset must include columns "SiteNumber" "CollectionYear". scale Scale NLCD data generated. Must "Cat" catchment "Ws" watershed. See Details information. group logical. NLCD data grouped broad categories? TRUE FALSE. See Details information.

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: Function returns site year dataframe NLCD data either catchment watershed scale.

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: Land-use/land-cover data extracted USGS National Land Cover Database (NLCD). LULC data available following years: 2001, 2004, 2006, 2008, 2011, 2013, 2016, 2019. years input data exact year matches list, years matched closest year NLCD data (e.g. site sampled 1995 NLCD data 2001). Note samples fall midpoint two NLCD years (e.g. 2005), function defaults earlier year (e.g. site sampled 2005 NLCD data 2004). Data can extracted catchment ("Cat") watershed ("Ws") scales. Watershed larger catchment includes land drains downstream sampling location. Catchment includes land upstream sampling location. NLCD data can grouped (group = TRUE) five broad categories. categories include "water" (grouping wetland open water land covers), "urban" (grouping urban land covers), "forest" (grouping deciduous, coniferous, mixed forests), "open" (grouping shrub, barren land, grassland, hay/pasture), "crop" (grouping, just crop land use). function gathers catchment/watershed NLCD data StreamCat API (Hill et al. 2016).

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: Hill, Ryan ., Marc H. Weber, Scott G. Leibowitz, Anthony R. Olsen, Darren J. Thornbrugh, 2016. Stream-Catchment (StreamCat) Dataset: Database Watershed Metrics Conterminous United States. Journal American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 52:120-128. DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12372.

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: Michael Mahon, Ryan Hill, Samantha Rumschlag, Terry Brown

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
code: if (FALSE) { ## Code to generate the percent land-use/land-cover in the catchment for ## site number "USGS-05276005" from 2007.    dat = data.frame(SiteNumber = "USGS-05276005",                    CollectionYear = 2007)    getNLCDData(data=dat,   scale = "Cat",   group = FALSE)   }
